Attempts to escape the Superposse by climbing rocks to safety after riding horses but is ultimately outpaced and shot.
Encourages Sundance and himself with confident statements like 'They’ll never get you' and 'come on you guys', showing confidence and motivation under pressure.
Nervously working with Sundance in a dangerous jungle heist, cautiously coordinating the robbery while trying to maintain control.
Whispers to Sundance and jokes about his age with friendly banter.
Shows consideration for the danger involved and tells others not to move to avoid conflict.
Plans and executes a robbery on a well-guarded payroll train, carefully coordinating with Sundance and managing to gather a large payroll despite obstacles.
Is nervous and swats away flies repeatedly, showing discomfort and some anxiety in the jungle environment.
Realistically assesses the size of the loot and improvises by loading the payroll on a mule to transport it efficiently.
Despite being older, continues to engage actively in risky criminal activities, indicating some decline but still operational.
Warns Sundance about potential danger in the jungle with a humorous tone, expresses his preference clearly but without dismissiveness.
Engages politely with the small white-haired restaurant owner, miming eating to communicate.
Tells the guards not to move and successfully leads them off to secure the payroll.
Disagrees with Sundance about working in the jungle citing danger from snakes, showing cautious judgment.
Engages local with basic miming to communicate about eating, showing resourcefulness despite language barrier.
Does not notice the branded silver-grey mule immediately after the local's smile fades.
Complains humorously about the food but continues to eat with Sundance.
Throws down his fork in frustration and decides the restaurant will no longer get his business after an attempt on his life.
Starts to crawl along the floor to a different window to seek a better position for getting more guns and continuing to fight.
Analyzes the dire situation with Sundance, acknowledging they can either stay and get killed or try to obtain more weapons.
Insists on facing danger himself to protect Sundance, saying 'I gotta be the one to go' and 'You can cover me'
Hands pistols silently to Sundance before confrontation
Dismisses Sundance's attempt to volunteer for a dangerous task with a lighthearted comment 'Why am I so damn smart all the time?'
Running, diving, rolling to avoid gunfire, maintaining movement to stay safe under heavy fire.
Dodges bullets skillfully, races to the mules to get ammunition, moves full out while avoiding gunfire effectively.
Somersaults and lies there pouring blood after being hit by bullets, indicating injury that hampers his effectiveness.
Manages to crawl and get inside a room under heavy gunfire, showing physical resilience and presence of mind.
Engages in a brief conversation with Sundance despite being severely wounded, maintaining composure under pressure.
Pushes himself up into a sitting position despite grievous wounds, indicating determination and mental toughness.
Shares his idea about where to go next, despite Sundance's dismissive attitude.
Responds calmly to Sundance's repeated rejections without anger or hostility.
Proposes a new plan despite previous failures, shows willingness to lead next move.
Sundance dismisses Butch's ideas due to past poor outcomes, indicating some failures in judgment or planning.
Explains the benefits of moving to Australia patiently and optimistically, emphasizing positive aspects like language compatibility, good climate, and opportunities.
Responds to Sundance's skepticism with a spirited shout, showing emotional investment and frustration with Sundance's negativity.
Encourages Sundance to consider the idea despite his doubts, showing persistence and desire to maintain dialogue.
Checks for danger (Lefors) and shows relief when none is found, demonstrating concern for safety of both.
